Okay. Here's the thing. I've read through the comments of other viewers --- some trashing the film and some saying it's the funniest, most enjoyable work of kubrick ever --- and I really don't know which group I should round out. I'll just warn from the beginning that I leaned toward the former collective, and fans of kubrick's earlier, denser works are unlikely to find this piece up to snuff.

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat (Gingy) stopping anyone going near the local priest Simon (Tim Choate).
